snippet: The tornado that struck Woodward, Okla., over the weekend stirred painful memories of the one that killed 107 people in the area in 1947, the deadliest in state history.
abstract: Tornado that struck Woodward, Okla, stirs painful memories for local resident Wilma Nelson, who had also survived one that killed 107 people in the area in 1947, the deadliest in state history.

byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Woodward, and Matt Flegenheimer from New York. Jennifer Preston and Channing Joseph contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The tornado that struck Woodward, Okla., over the weekend stirred painful memories of the one that killed 107 people in the area in 1947, the deadliest in state history.

headline.seo: In Woodward, Okla., Surviving a Twister Twice in 65 Years
headline.main: Surviving a Deadly Twister, Twice in 65 Years
